page.title: 11VILLAGE STUDY-EATON.
page.content: ROGER DE BUSLI DID NOT LIVE AT EATON BUT GAVE IT TO ONE OF HIS FOLLOWERS. IN THE LATER MIDDLE AGES EATON BECAME A ROYAL MANOR.THE LORDS OF THE MANOR BUILT THE HALL AND ENCLOSED THE PARK (NOW THE COLLEGE GROUNDS),FOUNDED A CHURCH AND BUILT A SCHOOL.{ {CHURCH}THE PRESENT CHURCH WAS BUILT IN THE YEARS 1858 TO 1861 AND WAS RESTORED IN 1948-49.THE MONEY FOR BUILDING THE CHURCH IN 1858 WAS PROVIDED BY HENRY SIMPSON,THE LORD OF THE MANOR,AND THE OWNER OF ALL THE PARISH LAND.IT WAS BUILT TO HOLD 150 PERSONS AND THE FIRST VICAR WAS CALLED REVEREND TWELLS.TODAY IT HAS NO VICAR AND THE SERVICES ARE CONDUCTED BY THE VICAR OF GAMSTON PARISH.TODAYS CONGREGATION USUALLY COMPRISES SOME TWENTY PEOPLE.
